contentTypes.name: Banner
contentTypes.description: An alert you want to display as soon as someone views a piece of advice content. Usually temporary - for example a warning at the top of a webpage that the law is about to change.

validations.message: Only bold marks are allowed
Only link to Url and link to entry nodes are allowed

contentTypes.name: Adviser warning
contentTypes.description:
A short, important message for advisers about how to use a piece of advice.

Appears on the website as a sticky box attached to the top of the screen.

validations.message: Only bold, italic, and underline marks are allowed
Only link to Url, link to entry, and link to asset nodes are allowed

contentTypes.name: Advice collection - public
contentTypes.description:
A self-contained piece of advice that answers a definitive user need from start to end. 

Appears on the website as a page.

validations.message: Only heading 2, heading 3, heading 4, ordered list, unordered list, horizontal rule, quote, block entry, asset, link to Url, link to entry, link to asset, and inline entry nodes are allowed
Please make this less than 250 characters, so it's easy to skim on a search results page

contentTypes.name: Monetary amount
contentTypes.description: A number that will appear as a value in pounds on the website. Use for things like benefit rates and tax thresholds.

validations.message: Please enter an amount in pounds, with a £ in front

contentTypes.name: Callout
contentTypes.description: Additional information connected to a larger piece of advice. Can be urgent (a red box on the website), standard (a yellow box on the website), or an example (a white box on the website). Can be used in public or adviser content.

validations.message: Only heading 2, heading 3, heading 4, ordered list, unordered list, horizontal rule, quote, block entry, asset, link to Url, link to entry, link to asset, and inline entry nodes are allowed

contentTypes.name: Contact details
contentTypes.description: An address, website, email address or phone number for an organisation or service.

validations.message: Only unordered list, quote, heading 2, heading 3, heading 4, ordered list, horizontal rule, link to Url, block entry, and link to entry nodes are allowed

contentTypes.name: Location-specific content
contentTypes.description: Part of a piece of content that's for a different combination of England, Scotland and Wales. For example, can be used as an 'extent box' in a public or adviser collection, callout, or anywhere else.

validations.message: Only heading 2, heading 3, heading 4, ordered list, unordered list, horizontal rule, quote, block entry, asset, link to Url, link to entry, link to asset, and inline entry nodes are allowed

contentTypes.name: Callout - adviser
contentTypes.description: Put this within an advice collection to include extra detail that's only relevant to advisers. On the website, appears as an adviser box, only visible to advisers.

validations.message: Only heading 2, heading 3, heading 4, ordered list, unordered list, horizontal rule, quote, block entry, asset, link to Url, link to entry, link to asset, and inline entry nodes are allowed

contentTypes.name: Content pattern
contentTypes.description: Premade sentences and paragraphs we reuse across the site

validations.message: Only bold, italic, and underline marks are allowed
Only heading 2, heading 3, heading 4, heading 5, heading 6, ordered list, unordered list, quote, block entry, asset, link to Url, link to entry, link to asset, and inline entry nodes are allowed

contentTypes.name: Targeted content - adviser
contentTypes.description: A piece of advice for a specific type of user. Appears as an adviser-only revealable on the website.

validations.message: Only heading 2, heading 3, heading 4, ordered list, unordered list, horizontal rule, quote, block entry, asset, link to Url, link to entry, link to asset, and inline entry nodes are allowed

contentTypes.name: Table
contentTypes.description: Add a table

contentTypes.name: Background text
contentTypes.description: Text that appears in the background, in occasional messages or in other incidental locations. For example, footers, search messages and errors.

validations.message: Only bold, italic, and underline marks are allowed
Only heading 2, heading 3, heading 4, link to Url, link to entry, asset, unordered list, ordered list, block entry, and inline entry nodes are allowed

contentTypes.name: Advice list
contentTypes.description: A curated group of advice collections on a particular theme.

validations.message: Only ordered list, unordered list, horizontal rule, quote, link to Url, link to entry, and link to asset nodes are allowed
Please make this less than 250 characters, so it's easy to skim on a search results page

contentTypes.name: Call costs
contentTypes.description: NOT YET FINALISED. Standard blocks of text explaining the costs of different calling different numbers.

validations.message: Only bold marks are allowed
Only inline entry and block entry nodes are allowed

contentTypes.name: Topic
contentTypes.description: NOT YET FINALISED Taxonomy entries for broad advice areas

contentTypes.name: Test type
contentTypes.description: NOT YET FINALISED

contentTypes.name: Advice collection - adviser
contentTypes.description: NOT YET FINALISED - WAITING TILL AFTER PUBLIC DONE.

validations.message: Only heading 2, heading 3, heading 4, ordered list, unordered list, horizontal rule, quote, block entry, asset, link to Url, link to entry, link to asset, and inline entry nodes are allowed

contentTypes.name: Template letter question
contentTypes.description: NOT YET FINALISED A question that we ask a user to prompt them to input a response. The response is used to construct a letter

contentTypes.name: Tag
contentTypes.description: NOT YET FINALISED These are just to help us find things in the CMS. Create and apply whatever tags you need to help you group your content.

contentTypes.name: Template letter
contentTypes.description: NOT YET FINALISED A way for users to create a correctly formatted letter to help with a number of problems.

validations.message: Only heading 3, heading 4, heading 5, heading 6, ordered list, unordered list, horizontal rule, quote, block entry, asset, link to Url, link to entry, link to asset, and inline entry nodes are allowed

contentTypes.name: Legislation link
contentTypes.description: NOT YET FINALISED Experimental: a link to some legislation and legal context explaining what it says.

validations.message: Only heading 2, heading 3, heading 4, heading 5, heading 6, ordered list, unordered list, horizontal rule, quote, link to Url, link to entry, and link to asset nodes are allowed

contentTypes.description: NOT YET FINALISED

contentTypes.name: Targeted content
contentTypes.description: A piece of advice for a specific type of user. Appears as a revealable on the website.

validations.message: Only heading 2, heading 3, heading 4, ordered list, unordered list, horizontal rule, quote, block entry, asset, link to Url, link to entry, link to asset, and inline entry nodes are allowed

settings.helpText: This title is just for finding the banner in the CMS - it doesn't show up when you add it to a page
What is this banner for? Who should we talk to about it?
This title is just for finding the warning in the CMS - it doesn't show up on the website
On the website, this warning appears in a sticky box at the top of the window on any page it's added to
Advisers will see this title instead of the public one
Leave this blank to keep it the same as the public meta description
Please fill this in whenever the page is fully factchecked
If you want to include a 'related pages' box, add the relevant collections here.
Describe what you've changed, why you've changed it and what source the change has come from
Selecting 'yes' hides this collection from Google, internal search and our website navigation. People will only be able to reach it from a direct url
This title is for identifying the callout in the CMS. It won't appear when you add the callout to a collection. To start the callout with a heading, add an h2 to the content field below
Start this field with an h2 if you want the callout to start with a heading. The title field above won't show up when you add the callout to a collection
This doesn't appear on the page - it's just for identifying contact details in the CMS
Add your contact details here. For phone numbers, include call costs as an embedded content item

This title DOESN'T appear when you add the unit to a collection. If you want the unit to start with an H2 or similar, put an H2 at the start of the body. Include the selected audience at the end of the title.
This title is for identifying the callout in the CMS. It won't appear when you add the callout to a collection. To start the callout with a heading, add an h2 to the content field below
Start this field with an h2 if you want the callout to start with a heading. The title field above won't show up when you add the callout to a collection
This doesn't show up on the website - it's just to identify the pattern in the CMS
Use this for the optional text that shows up at the top of some old index pages
Select any content that appears under this in the navigation - for example, the pages that will appear on an index
Box list is the old style of index page, like the benefits index. Text list is the newer style, like consumer.
Leave this blank to keep it the same as the public meta description
Selecting 'yes' hides this collection from Google, internal search and our website navigation. People will only be able to reach it from a direct url

Some topics have totally separate adviser and public content. Here you can identify where we have different content that covers the same user need. Leave blank where Advisernet has the same content as the public site
Describe what you've changed, why you've changed it and what source the change has come from
For multiple choice questions, enter the options users can choose from
Enter the text that appears on the example letter before users answer the questions themselves
This should be the name of the piece of legislation. This is the link text that will appear on the website
Link to the latest version of the relevant legislation
